title.narrative: Microfinance V - Access to Finance for the Poor

description.narrative: Access to Finance for the Poor Phase Five (AFP V) Project’s overall objective is to improve access to sustainable financial services for rural women and men at household and Micro and Small Enterprise (MSMEs) levels, thereby contributing to inclusive economic development. AFP V will be implemented by Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH (GIZ). The government counterpart will be the Bank of Lao PDR (BoL). At the national level, AFP V will strengthen BoL’s capacity to develop, supervise and regulate access to financial services. At the regional level, it will build the capacity of financial institutions called Network Support Organisations (NSOs) to support and service village banks. At the local level, AFP V will work directly with over 671 village banks to improve the sustainability of their operations and quality of their financial products. The total value of this investment is $3.23 million to be expensed over 2.6 years, starting in the 2018-19 financial year
